frameDefinitions: The words in this frame refer to what Clothing the Wearer (or a specific Body_part of the Wearer) has on.

Commerce is a situation in which a Buyer and a Seller have agreed upon an exchange of Money and Goods (possibly after a negotiation), and then perform the exchange, optionally carrying it out with various kinds of direct payment or financing or the giving of change.
A Distributor sells, lends, or otherwise distributes a class of Goods.
An Agent acts to begin the life of a Process.
This frame concerns entities conventionally being referred to by particular names.
An Owner has (or lacks) a Possession. '' 'The river's part of my  manor, but of course it also belongs to the River Police.'
frameExamples: I <t>had</t> <t>on</t> the most ridiculous monkey-suit you could imagine.
Trader Joe's <t>carries</t> a wide variety of foods, drinks, and househole necessities.
After discovering her knack for organization, she decided to try to  <t>launch</t> a career in human resources.
The river's part of my  manor, but of course it also <t>belongs</t> to the River Police.
listRoleDefinitions: The person whose clothing is under discussion.
This role identifies the <fen>Clothing</fen> that the <fen>Wearer</fen> wears.
The body part of the <fen>Wearer</fen> which is covered by the <fen>Clothing</fen>.
The time at or during which the <fen>Wearer</fen> has the <fen>Clothing</fen> on.
The <fen>Buyer</fen> has the <fen>Money</fen> and wants the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The <fen>Seller</fen> has the <fen>Goods</fen> and wants the <fen>Money</fen>.
<fen>Money</fen> is given in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen> in a transaction.
<fen>Goods</fen> is anything including labor or time, for example, which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
The <fen>Distributor</fen> maintains a store of <fen>Goods</fen> for the purpose of selling or otherwise distributing them.
The <fen>Goods</fen> are kept on hand and distributed by the <fen>Distributor</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Distributor</fen> carries the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the carrying of <fen>Goods</fen> occurs.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the process that the <fen>Agent</fen> initiates.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the actor responsible for starting the <fen>Process</fen>.
This role is for the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> initiates the <fen>Process</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Process</fen> is initiated.
<fen>Name</fen> identifies the linguistic expression used to refer to Entities.
The <fen>Entity</fen> is the person the speaker intends to refer to by using a particular name.
The entity that owns a posession.

The thing which is owned by the Owner.
Ex.:  I <t>have</t> <fex name='Possession'>twenty bucks</fex>.
(This does not include bodyparts or medical conditions, but does include intellectual property, etc.)
This role indicates the <fen>Time</fen> interval during which the <fen>Owner</fen> has a possession.
listRoleExamples: She was wearing a glove <fex>on one hand</fex>.
<fex>By five o'clock</fex>, he was wearing the old holey jeans and t-shirt again.
She was considered a <fex>purchaser</fex> of the finest things
<fex>My local grocery store</fex> raised prices on meat
The price of the sweater was <fex> $50</fex>.
She was considered a purchaser <fex>of the finest things</fex>

passageCandidateSpans.text: the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Who Can Own a Full-Auto Machine Gun
